inclusion.criterion: Patient aged from 6 months to 18 years old, residing in France, with a D+HUS according to the definition used by the National Institute for Public Health Surveillance (InVS)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Renal impairment with a serum creatinine > 60μmol/l in children less than 2 years old and > 75μmol/l over 2 years old
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: AND hemolytic anemia defined by hemoglobin < 10g/dl associated with schizocytes ≥ 2%
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Collection of free and informed consent of the holders of parental authority
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Administration of antibiotics in the 15 days preceding the diagnosis of D+HUS.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Personal or family history of atypical HUS .
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: More than 15 days between the onset of diarrhea and the diagnosis of D+HUS.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Hypersensitivity to azithromycin, erythromycin, or any macrolide
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: patient treated with dihydroergotamine, ergotamine or cisapride
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: No affiliation to a social security scheme (beneficiary or legal)
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient has been experiencing vomiting, non-bloody diarrhea, abdominal pain, fever, chills and loss of appetite for the past 3 days. He ate a salad at a restaurant prior to his diarrhea onset.
